attributes.title: Simultaneous Fitting of Multiple Neural Networks

children: Simultaneous Fitting of Multiple Neural Networks
In many cases users are interested in fitting multiple neural networks or parameters simultaneously. This tutorial addresses how to perform this kind of study.
The following is a fully working demo on the Fitzhugh-Nagumo ODE:
acts on a single parameter vector
. Thus what we do here is concatenate all of the parameters into a single vector
and then train on this parameter vector. Whenever we need to evaluate the neural networks, we cut the vector and grab the portion that corresponds to the neural network. For example, the
, which is why the first neural network's evolution is written like
This method is flexible to use with many optimizers and in fairly optimized ways. The allocations can be reduced by using
. We can also see with the
that we can grab parameters directly out of the vector and use them as needed.
